page.title: 08Fairs & Festivals,Liskeard
page.content: {Liskeard Furry Dance}(of dubious antiquity) is held in June during the town's Carnival Week.The Liskeard Silver Band,followed by the Mayor and Mayoress,lead the dancers in a winding route through the streets that are lined with spectators.Some of the dancers wear fancy dress and the best costumes win a prize.All the money that is collected along the route aids the charity work of the Lions'Club. {St.Matthew's Day Fair}(once a cattle fair) is held in the town's Cattle Market and streets.In one half of the Market,local schools,charities and organisations erect brightly decorated stalls and,in the other half,the long awaited travelling funfair with its dodgems, helterskelter and big wheel fills the usually quiet town with music,noise and excitement.
